metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8501 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in bfd/peXXigen.c in GNU binutils 2.24 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) and possibly have other unspecified impact via a crafted NumberOfRvaAndSizes field in the AOUT header in a PE executable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8501` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-mips-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-mips64-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> binutils USN description: Hanno Böck discovered that the _bfd_XXi_swap_aouthdr_in function in libbfd in GNU binutils allowed out-of-bounds writes. An attacker could use this to craft input that could cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: binutils package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24.90.20141111-2ubuntu1').
gdb package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.04').
